---
title: "Remove non-unique rows and cleaned up job_location and job_salary columns"
author: "Eric Lehmphul"
date: "11/29/2021"
output: html_document
---

```{r}
a <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/baruab/Team2_Project_3_607/main/glassdoor_datascience_updated.csv")

a <- a[4:14]
```



```{r}
library(dplyr)

data <- distinct(a)
```


```{r}
library(tidyr)
data1 <- separate(data = data, col = job_location, into = c("city", "state"), sep = ", ")
```

```{r}
data1$job_salary[c(2, 7, 8, 13, 14, 18, 23, 24, 26, 27, 29, 36, 37, 39, 40, 41, 42, 43, 44, 45, 46, 48:54, 57, 58, 59, 61:63)] <- "Not Provided"
data1$city[2] <- "Not Provided"
data1$state[2] <- "MA"
data1$state[data1$city == "Remote"] <- "Remote"
data1$city[23] <- "St. Louis"
data1$state[23] <- "MI"
data1$state[57] <- "United States"
```


```{r}
write.csv(data1, "unique_job_postings.csv")
```
